summary: This document is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS Person Encounter List detailing the flight travel history of Jeffrey Epstein from 2017 to 2019. It logs numerous private jet flights between locations including Teterboro, West Palm Beach, Paris, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, providing a timeline of his movements during this period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in this travel log, showing his frequent private jet travel between various U.S. and international airports from 2017 to 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Frequent Private Jet Travel
events.description: Numerous private jet flights logged by U.S. Customs and Border Protection, showing Epstein's travel patterns between various locations including Teterboro (KTEB), West Palm Beach (KPBI), Paris (LFPB), and the U.S. Virgin Islands (TIST).

locations: Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas (Cyril King Airport)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein maintained extensive private jet travel between 2017 and 2019, with flights recorded up to April 2019.
Primary travel routes included frequent trips between Teterboro, NJ (KTEB) and West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI), as well as international travel to Paris (LFPB) and the U.S. Virgin Islands (TIST).
The document shows Epstein used multiple private aircraft with tail numbers N212JE, N120JE, and N415LM during this period.
Travel records continue through April 2019, indicating Epstein was actively traveling during the period leading up to his July 2019 arrest.
The document was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 22, 2019, suggesting ongoing law enforcement monitoring of his movements.
